docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 12 -- Seven women who had been sentenced to thirty days in jail for an "unauthorized meeting" in Calle Florida, Wednesday at which cries of "viva la constitucion" were heard were ordered released under provisional liberty...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 12 -- Seven women who had been sentenced to thirty days in jail for an "unauthorized meeting" in Calle Florida, Wednesday at which cries of "viva la constitucion" were heard were ordered released under provisional liberty yesterday without prejudice to the legal continuance of the action.
docs.abstract: Claims right to aid 2 women sentenced by Argentine ct for anti-Peron demonstration

headline.main: ARGENTINE COURTS DIFFER ON RULINGS; One Judge Releases 7 Women for Disturbance -- Another Then Resentences Them

docs.snippet: The Union of South Africa may have to impose import controls as it is using up its dollar reserve and its gold "faster than it can be mined," Atherton Clark, assistant export manager of the Black  Decker Manufacturing Company, said yesterday.

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market milled between the depressing influence of the foreign political situation -- particularly the French Cabinet crisis -- and the news which came late in the week of the creditable showing of the British trade figures for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market milled between the depressing influence of the foreign political situation -- particularly the French Cabinet crisis -- and the news which came late in the week of the creditable showing of the British trade figures for the first six months of 1948. It was this latter incident which changed sentiment and quickly punctured the earlier gloom.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Sept. 17, 1948

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 24 -- John Francis Griffith, charged for the second time in less than six months by the Peron regime with complicity in anti-Government plots, said in Uruguay today that the current charge was baseless.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 25 -- Rear Admiral Fidel Anadon, Naval Minister, who has been serving also as acting Foreign Minister, resigned this morning because of a "misunderstanding" with President Juan D. Peron. This evening President Peron swore in...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 25 -- Rear Admiral Fidel Anadon, Naval Minister, who has been serving also as acting Foreign Minister, resigned this morning because of a "misunderstanding" with President Juan D. Peron. This evening President Peron swore in Admiral Enrique Garcia as the new Naval Minister.

headline.main: NAVAL LEADER OUT IN ARGENTINE SHIFT; Admiral Who Served as Acting Foreign Head Quits -- Police Guard Griffith in Uruguay
